title: Fitness-Based PE Instruction
outcomes: Design fitness lessons aligned to standards and learner needs.
Use performance evidence to determine mastery and advancement.
Apply safe strength and conditioning guidelines for adolescents.

resources.title: Promoting Active Lifestyles in Schools
resources.notes: Use for school-wide physical activity models and curriculum framing.

resources.title: Exercise Testing and Prescription
resources.notes: Use to design valid assessment tasks and interpretation checkpoints.

resources.title: NSCA Guide to High School Strength and Conditioning
resources.notes: Use for safe strength programming and progression principles.

modules.title: Module 1: Competency-Based Foundations
modules.competency: Explain competency-based mastery learning for PE in practice.
modules.instruction: Read the assigned section from Promoting Active Lifestyles in Schools and take notes on mastery progression language.
modules.contentConnection: Connect course outcomes to how evidence is collected before advancement.
modules.learningTask: Create a concept map showing competency targets, evidence types, and advancement rules.
modules.applicationTask: Submit a one-page concept map and a 150-word rationale describing how your progression decisions protect instructional quality.

masteryCheck.prompt: In 4-6 sentences, explain competency targets, mastery evidence, and how students advance.

modules.title: Module 2: Standards and Outcome Mapping
modules.competency: Align PE standards and course outcomes to measurable module competencies.
modules.instruction: Review your standards matrix and identify verbs that can be observed and scored.
modules.contentConnection: Use the text examples to translate broad goals into measurable statements.
modules.learningTask: Map at least 3 PE standards to outcomes and write one measurable competency for each.
modules.applicationTask: Build a standards-to-competency table with measurable performance indicators.

masteryCheck.prompt: Which outcome statement is most measurable for competency-based progression?
options: Students can complete a 3-station circuit safely with correct form on at least 4 of 5 criteria.
Students should try their best in class.

modules.title: Module 3: Baseline Fitness Assessment
modules.competency: Design and administer a baseline assessment protocol with valid data collection.
modules.instruction: Read Exercise Testing and Prescription guidance on validity, safety, and sequence of testing.
modules.contentConnection: Identify which measures will be used later for growth comparisons.
modules.learningTask: Build a baseline protocol including safety screen, test sequence, and scoring sheet.
modules.applicationTask: Submit your baseline protocol with a data table template and safety notes.

masteryCheck.prompt: Describe your baseline protocol and explain how it supports valid before/after comparisons.

modules.title: Module 4: Performance Rubrics and Mastery Levels
modules.competency: Create a rubric with clear novice, developing, proficient, and advanced descriptors.
modules.instruction: Review rubric examples and isolate criteria that are observable in a PE setting.
modules.contentConnection: Ensure each level can be scored consistently by different instructors.
modules.learningTask: Draft a 4-level rubric for one movement competency and include observable criteria.
modules.applicationTask: Submit a completed 4-level rubric and a short scoring guide.

masteryCheck.prompt: Which rubric descriptor is strongest for reliable scoring?
options: Student shows good effort most days.
Student demonstrates proper squat mechanics on 8 of 10 reps with neutral spine and knee tracking.

modules.title: Module 5: Safe Strength and Conditioning Design
modules.competency: Plan age-appropriate strength and conditioning sessions using safe progression principles.
modules.instruction: Read the NSCA high school progression guidance and identify risk controls.
modules.contentConnection: Tie your session design to adolescent safety and progression over time.
modules.learningTask: Draft a 2-week microcycle with warm-up, primary lifts, accessories, and recovery.
modules.applicationTask: Submit your microcycle with rationale for load progression and supervision points.

masteryCheck.prompt: Explain your progression choices and the safety safeguards used for adolescent learners.

modules.title: Module 6: Differentiation and Intervention
modules.competency: Differentiate instruction and interventions based on student performance evidence.
modules.instruction: Review baseline and rubric data examples and classify students by support need.
modules.contentConnection: Intervention decisions must be tied to evidence, not participation alone.
modules.learningTask: Create a tiered intervention plan for students below, at, and above target mastery.
modules.applicationTask: Submit a tiered intervention matrix with coaching cues and reassessment trigger.

masteryCheck.prompt: Which intervention best reflects evidence-based differentiation?
options: Give every student the same task regardless of assessment results.
Use baseline and rubric data to assign targeted technique stations and coaching cues.
Advance all students to the next module after one class period.

modules.title: Module 7: Feedback, Reassessment, and Advancement
modules.competency: Use actionable feedback cycles and reassessment criteria to support mastery growth.
modules.instruction: Review feedback loop examples and draft a reassessment policy with timelines.
modules.contentConnection: Students should know exactly what to improve before reassessment.
modules.learningTask: Design a feedback protocol with clear reassessment windows and advancement cutoffs.
modules.applicationTask: Submit a feedback/reassessment workflow including communication templates.

masteryCheck.prompt: Describe how students receive feedback, when they reassess, and what counts as mastery.

modules.title: Module 8: Capstone Implementation Plan
modules.competency: Integrate outcomes, assessment, safety, and progression into a complete PE unit plan.
modules.instruction: Review all prior module deliverables and combine them into one coherent unit implementation plan.
modules.contentConnection: Your capstone must show direct alignment between competencies, evidence, and grade reporting.
modules.learningTask: Produce a capstone unit plan that includes timeline, assessments, differentiation, and reporting.
modules.applicationTask: Submit the full unit packet with assessment tools, progression rules, and gradebook mapping.

masteryCheck.prompt: Which capstone plan is most aligned to competency-based instruction?
options: A weekly plan that grades attendance and gives one final test at the end.
A sequenced unit with baseline data, rubric checkpoints, reassessment opportunities, and advancement by demonstrated mastery.
A plan with engaging activities but no explicit criteria for progression.
